DataElement.preferredName: Cervical Cancer AJCC Edition 8 Pathologic Tumor T Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the primary cervical carcinoma based on clinical stage information combined with operative findings, and evidence obtained from pathology review when surgery is the first definitive therapy, using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to pathologic T stage of a cervical tumor (or cancer of the uterine cervix).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Relating to a neck, or cervix, in any sense.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.longName: Cervical
Concepts.definition: Relating to a neck, or cervix, in any sense.

Concepts.longName: Neoplasm
Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

Concepts.longName: Pathologic
Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.

Concepts.longName: T Category
Concepts.definition: One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 12/13/18 tmt versioned; DEC Qualifier Concept for Pathologic was added in order to match DEC Long Name.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Cervical Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 Pathologic T Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of cervical cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion)._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cervical Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cervical Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cervical cancer invading the mucosa of the bladder or rectum, and/or extending beyond the true pelvis (bullous edema is not sufficient to classify a tumor as T4). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cervical Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cervical cancer invading the mucosa of the bladder or rectum, and/or extending beyond the true pelvis (bullous edema is not sufficient to classify a tumor as T4). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cervical Cancer pT3b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cervical Cancer pT3b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cervical cancer extending to pelvic wall and/or causing hydronephrosis or nonfunctioning kidney. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cervical Cancer pT3b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cervical cancer extending to pelvic wall and/or causing hydronephrosis or nonfunctioning kidney. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cervical Cancer pT3a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cervical Cancer pT3a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cervical cancer involving the lower third of vagina but not extending to pelvic wall. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cervical Cancer pT3a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cervical cancer involving the lower third of vagina but not extending to pelvic wall. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cervical Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cervical Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cervical cancer extending to pelvic sidewall and/or involving the lower third of vagina, and/or causing hydronephrosis or nonfunctioning kidney. The pelvic sidewall is defined as the muscle, fascia, neurovascular structures, and skeletal portions of the bony pelvis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cervical Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cervical cancer extending to pelvic sidewall and/or involving the lower third of vagina, and/or causing hydronephrosis or nonfunctioning kidney. The pelvic sidewall is defined as the muscle, fascia, neurovascular structures, and skeletal portions of the bony pelvis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cervical Cancer pT2b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cervical Cancer pT2b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cervical carcinoma invading beyond the uterus but not to the pelvic wall or to lower third of vagina with parametrial invasion. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cervical Cancer pT2b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cervical carcinoma invading beyond the uterus but not to the pelvic wall or to lower third of vagina with parametrial invasion. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cervical Cancer pT2a2 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cervical Cancer pT2a2 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cervical carcinoma invading beyond the uterus but not to the pelvic wall or to lower third of vagina without parametrial invasion. Clinically visible lesion more than 4.0 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cervical Cancer pT2a2 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cervical carcinoma invading beyond the uterus but not to the pelvic wall or to lower third of vagina without parametrial invasion. Clinically visible lesion more than 4.0 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cervical Cancer pT2a1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cervical Cancer pT2a1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cervical carcinoma invading beyond the uterus but not to the pelvic wall or to lower third of vagina without parametrial invasion. Clinically visible lesion 4.0 cm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cervical Cancer pT2a1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cervical carcinoma invading beyond the uterus but not to the pelvic wall or to lower third of vagina without parametrial invasion. Clinically visible lesion 4.0 cm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cervical Cancer pT2a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cervical Cancer pT2a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cervical carcinoma invading beyond the uterus but not to the pelvic wall or to lower third of vagina without parametrial invasion. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cervical Cancer pT2a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cervical carcinoma invading beyond the uterus but not to the pelvic wall or to lower third of vagina without parametrial invasion. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cervical Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cervical Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cervical carcinoma invading beyond the uterus but not to the pelvic wall or to lower third of vagina. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cervical Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cervical carcinoma invading beyond the uterus but not to the pelvic wall or to lower third of vagina. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cervical Cancer pT1b2 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cervical Cancer pT1b2 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cervical cancer with clinically visible lesion more than 4.0 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cervical Cancer pT1b2 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cervical cancer with clinically visible lesion more than 4.0 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cervical Cancer pT1b1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cervical Cancer pT1b1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cervical cancer with clinically visible lesion 4.0 cm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cervical Cancer pT1b1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cervical cancer with clinically visible lesion 4.0 cm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cervical Cancer pT1b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cervical Cancer pT1b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cervical cancer with clinically visible lesion confined to the cervix or microscopic lesion greater than T1a/IA2. It includes all macroscopically visible lesions, even those with superficial invasion. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cervical Cancer pT1b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cervical cancer with clinically visible lesion confined to the cervix or microscopic lesion greater than T1a/IA2. It includes all macroscopically visible lesions, even those with superficial invasion. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cervical Cancer pT1a2 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cervical Cancer pT1a2 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Invasive cervical carcinoma with measured stromal invasion of more than 3.0 mm and not more than 5.0 mm, with a horizontal spread of 7.0 mm or less. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cervical Cancer pT1a2 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Invasive cervical carcinoma with measured stromal invasion of more than 3.0 mm and not more than 5.0 mm, with a horizontal spread of 7.0 mm or less. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cervical Cancer pT1a1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cervical Cancer pT1a1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Invasive cervical carcinoma with measured stromal invasion of 3.0 mm or less in depth and 7.0 mm or less in horizontal spread. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cervical Cancer pT1a1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Invasive cervical carcinoma with measured stromal invasion of 3.0 mm or less in depth and 7.0 mm or less in horizontal spread. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cervical Cancer pT1a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cervical Cancer pT1a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Invasive cervical carcinoma diagnosed only by microscopy. Stromal invasion with a maximum depth of 5.0 mm measured from the base of the epithelium and a horizontal spread of 7.0 mm or less. Vascular space involvement, venous or lymphatic, does not affect classification. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cervical Cancer pT1a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Invasive cervical carcinoma diagnosed only by microscopy. Stromal invasion with a maximum depth of 5.0 mm measured from the base of the epithelium and a horizontal spread of 7.0 mm or less. Vascular space involvement, venous or lymphatic, does not affect classification. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cervical Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cervical Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cervical carcinoma confined to uterus (extension to corpus should be disregarded). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cervical Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cervical carcinoma confined to uterus (extension to corpus should be disregarded). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cervical Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cervical Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cervical cancer with no evidence of primary tumor. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cervical Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cervical cancer with no evidence of primary tumor. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cervical Cancer pTX TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cervical Cancer pTX TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cervical cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cervical Cancer pTX TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cervical cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Cervical Cancer Pathologic TNM Finding v8 American Joint Committee on Cancer T Category Category
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of cervical cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system.:A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.:One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).:A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

Concepts.longName: Cervical Cancer Pathologic TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of cervical cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system.

Concepts.longName: American Joint Committee on Cancer
Concepts.definition: A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.

Concepts.longName: T Category
Concepts.definition: One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

Concepts.longName: Category
Concepts.definition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueDomain.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8-20-19 released per MC.; 12/5/18 tmt created for standardization.

DataElement.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElement.changeDescription: 8-30-19 TMT released per MC.; 12/6/18 tmt created for standardization.
